item.title: [IPL-10808] PA by amount - Partial Cancel
item.description:
Introduction

Merchant should be able to partial activate orders by only providing the activation amount via API & BO

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Currently an order can be activated with or w/o articles,that means when no acticle details are provided. Partial activation requests contain negative rebate only and no cart We need to do some additional adaptions when doing so, in order to avoid confusion

Changing an order via BO

As-Is: In the BO, changes of the order can only be done on the main order and are applied via partial cancel request to main and sub orders.
Should-Be: In the BO, changes are made on main and suborders if partial activation is enabled. In this case, changes are applied via edit_cart_content request through a user friendly GUI.

The following chart illustrates which parts of the GUI for modifying an order should be displayed under which conditions:

When partial acitvation is enabled, all changes are applied via a special dialog that is opened when the user clicks on "Teilstorno" / "update order". This dialog results in an editCartContent request. The main order view in this case is read-only.

Note: when partial activation is disabled, changes to the order are preformed using the main order form. The GUI elements affected are display in the image in section "Fix display logic for activation button".

There exist two different views for the editCartContent dialog:

View 1: Amount based ECC dialog when partial activation is enabled ("no cart" condition is true)

View 2: Item based ECC dialog when partial activation is enabled ("no cart" condition is false)

The data displayed in the image for the amount based ECC dialog corresponds to the editCartContent request that looks as follows (it is not necessary to generate the full XML request. Instead some fragments should be used to call the respective stored:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<data api_version="1.5.3">
	<default_params mid="1" pid="1"
		bpsecure="0cc175b9c0f1b6a831c399e269772661" />
	<total shippingname="n/a" shippingprice="126"
		shippingpricegross="0" rebate="0" rebategross="0" carttotalprice="3900"
		carttotalpricegross="3900" currency="EUR" reference="REF007" />
	<article_data>
		<article articleid="BP_NO_CART" articlequantity="1"
			articlename="Ihre Bestellung bei home24.de" articleprice="3900"
			articlepricegross="3900" />
	</article_data>
	<invoice_list>
		<invoice invoice_number="REF007/1">
			<invoice_params carttotalpricegross="2600"
				carttotalprice="2600" rebate="-2600" rebategross="-2600" shippingprice="0"
				shippingpricegross="0" currency="EUR" />
		</invoice>
		<invoice invoice_number="REF007/2">
			<invoice_params carttotalpricegross="700"
				carttotalprice="700" rebate="-700" rebategross="-700" shippingprice="0"
				shippingpricegross="0" currency="EUR" />
		</invoice>
	</invoice_list>
</data>

Note: Class ProcessEditCartContentProc.java can be used to perform the editCartContent request by invoking stored procedure ipl_api.process_edit_cart_content.

Decline PC requests when the "No cart" condition is true

Adjust ipaylater_customer.partial_cancel_order and return new error code and error messages. That way the check will also be done from PCs initiated in the BO (although doing a PC via BO should not be possible anymore because their is no GUI for it anymore).

Create regression tests for partial activation and cancellation by amount.

E-Mails (this is for a diffrent user story)

All merchants, we allow (know how to do this) activation by amount, we should provide them a custom activation - , parcel_cancel- and edit_cart_content - e-mail, in order to avoid confusion with "empty" artikel etc. This will be possible, when IPL-9079 is done.

Paument method support:

Beacuse partial activation is available only for DD and INV. The activation by amount is only available for DD and INV.
For not partialy activated amount
item.summary: PA by amount - Partial Cancel

item.title: [IPL-10807] PA by amount - Partial Activation (BO&Bug)
item.description:
Introduction

Merchant should be able to partial activate orders by only providing the activation amount via API & BO

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Currently an order can be activated with or w/o articles,that means when no acticle details are provided. Partial activation requests contain negative rebate only and no cart We need to do some additional adaptions when doing so, in order to avoid confusion

"No cart" orders

Merchants who want to use partial activation by amount typically cannot provide any cart details, neither in the preauthorize/prescore requests nor in the activation request.

Our system in many places relies on the presence of cart data. So far we can send preauthorize requests with a single item and partially activate orders by a negative rebate. But mainly the BO design look&feel in this case is not very intuitive.

Therefore we introduce the notion of "No cart" orders. When we receive such an order from the merchant the BO look&feel should be a different one compared to normal orders.

Conditions for a main order without cart ("No cart" condition):
-> Either in the cart exists at least one article with article ID BP_NO_CART
-> Or mrc_process_by_amount = true

New merchant configuration

Create boolean column mrc_process_by_amount (default: false) and display checkbox in the BO.

Requests

"NO CART" request (preauthorize):

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<data tcaccepted="1" expecteddaystillshipping="0"
	capturerequestnecessary="0" paymenttype="1" api_version="1.5.1">
	<default_params mid="1" pid="1"
		bpsecure="0cc175b9c0f1b6a831c399e269772661" />
	<customer_details customertype="n"
		salutation="Herr" title="" firstName="Bill" lastName="Payman"
		street="Zinnowitzer Str." streetNo="1" addressAddition="" zip="10115"
		city="Berlin" country="DEU" email="it-sw@billpay.de" phone=""
		cellPhone="" birthday="19770707" language="de" ip="127.0.0.1"
		customerGroup="p" />
	<shipping_details useBillingAddress="1" />
	<total shippingname="n/a" shippingprice="0"
		shippingpricegross="0" rebate="0" rebategross="0" carttotalprice="25900"
		carttotalpricegross="25900" currency="EUR" reference="REF007"></total>
	<article_data>
		<article articleid="BP_NO_CART" articlequantity="1" articlename="Ihre Bestellung bei home24.de"
			articleprice="25900" articlepricegross="25900" />
	</article_data>
</data>

"Partial activation by amount" request (already works like it is). The merchant has to provide the activation amount as negative value in fields rebate/rebategross and positive value in fields carttotalgross/carttotalprice of the partial version of the invoiceCreated request.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<data api_version="1.5.6">
	<default_params mid="1" pid="1"
		bpsecure="0cc175b9c0f1b6a831c399e269772661" />
	<invoice_params carttotalgross="5500" currency="EUR"
		reference="REF007" delayindays="0" is_partial="1" invoice_number="REF007/1"
		shippingname="" shippingprice="0" shippingpricegross="0" rebate="-5500"
		rebategross="-5500" carttotalprice="5500">
	</invoice_params>
</data>

Partial activation requests like this can already be sent via API. Via BO the GUI validation logic currently disallows to provide negative rebate. In any way the BO GUI will be changed at that point (see section Activation dialog in BO).

Note: Typically there will be no tax values or cart details provided in the preauthorize and invoiceCreated request. However if the information is provided, we have to process store/process it the usual way.

Activation dialog in BO

Currently, there are two different views for the activation dialog in the BO: When partial activation is deactivated (mrc_partial_activation_enabled=false), a Yes/No dialog is shown in order to either fully activate the order or cancel the operation. When partial activation is enabled (mrc_partial_activation_enabled=true) the unactivated part of the main order is displayed in order to allow for activation of the remaining items/shipping/rebate. For activation of "No cart" orders we will provide a third view.

This diagram illustrates which view of the activation dialog is shown under which conditions:

We have to adjust the function that decides which dialog to show: if partial activation is enabled and the main order is a "No cart" order, then display a dialog view where the user can insert the desired amount for activation:

  • Pressing the submit button will create the "Partial activation by amount" request in section Requests.
  • Activation amount must be positive (resulting in a negative rebate=rebategross for the acitivation request).
  • The text field with stepper should by prefilled with the unactivated amount of the main order, i.e. 
    co_order_total_worth(main_order) - sum(co_order_total_worth(sub_orders))
  • The maximum amount of the text field with stepper should be the unactivated amount of the main order.

Fix display logic for activation button

1) The activation button in the BO should not be displayed when the whole main order amount is used by suborders:

co_order_total_worth(main_order) = sum(co_order_total_worth(sub_orders))

Currently the button is still displayed when an order is fully activated using the amount based partial activation request.
item.summary: PA by amount - Partial Activation (BO&Bug)

item.title: [IPL-10783] Enable Merchants to choose between our different Transaction Credit Types
item.description:
Introduction

We want to enable some Merchants (portals) to choose between different TC-Condition-Models by themself. Therefore we have to provide a possibilty for that in the BO.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
No-Status-Quo Merchant can choose between different TC condition models in the BO

1. New table

We have to provide a new table: "ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option", where we save the conditions (values) for each portal TC/country/currency combination. This new table has the same structure as ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment. Primary Key has to be auto increment (Not portal ID)

Note: ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option table is maintained directly from IT in the DB. No UI in the BO for these TC-condition-models.

2. Logic for enabeling Merchants to choose model

When rendering the BO GUI for the TC payment options for a certain portal, we do the following: If the table ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option contains entries -> display drop-down in the BO and a save button in order to let the merchant select a set of conditions.

3. Logic when condition model is selected

  • When Merchant is allowed to switch model
  • Display drop down
  • Merchant choose model
  • Merchant save model
  • overwright ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment table with values from ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option
  • display values in merchnat view (read only)

4. Merchant View

Merchant should be able to select and switch by himself the type of TC he wants to use at any time. The switch should be done in BO by merchant. (and Admin)
When new model is choose - display new values in BO (read only)
Important: The merchant should use the new saving button (see screenshot) to commit model.

Note: Right now there are 4 Different types of TC: (But must be generic for the future)

  • normal TC (customer pays interests + 1,95 EUR handling fee/ merchant pays normal disagio)
  • 0% (customer doesn't pay interests/ customer pays 1,95 EUR handling fee/ merchant pays transaction fee and disagio)
  • 0% effective (customer pay nothing/ merchant pays 1,95 EUR handling fee + transaction fee + disagio)
  • fix Rate (customers pays fix amount including interests/ merchant pays 1,95 EUR handling fee + normal disagio)

Note: No default values necessary

Note/Additional Information
  • Creates a USP for merchants (they can make 'special sales' everytime they need/ want)
  • Decreases our manual work to switch the TC-types.
  • do not show the merchant more than what is able to see right now (there have been incidents, where we displayed information, which are not meant for the merchants)
  • do not allow the merchant to change more than what he is able to do now (same as above)
  • only show this new feature to merchants, which we enable to do so and only the options, which we enable (e.g. if we only enable standard TC, then only show standard TC)
TODO
  • implement new table
  • create dropdown display logic (and button)
  • create load logic from merchant_configuration_payment_option to merchant_configuration_payment table
  • create load logic (from merchant_configuration_payment table to BO; after each update)
  • Adjust BO Design
  • test merchant invoice - when switching
item.summary: Enable Merchants to choose between our different Transaction Credit Types

comments.comment: @Duc/Stefan: please think about/provide a screenshot, how adding such sets of config parameters should look like. Please do not restrict to 4 sets but keep it generic. Also please keep in mind that 95% of the merchants only have one set of parameters. So setting the default parameters must not become more diffult than it is right now.
Was 3 story points. Changes made -> re estimate.

item.title: [IPL-10127] shopping portal CSV Reports Anpassungen
item.description:
IST-Prozess:

Die Hanseatic schickt uns nicht wie vereinbart alle csv reports.
Folglich lagen bis dato nicht alle reports vor.

Soll-Prozess:

Anpassung der Reports:

Report 1 accepted:
Drei Instanzen beim FTP-Server abgelegt
1.EVOLAN historisch: alle relevanten Konten bis zum Ende von Evolan
-> billpayEV_accepted_2013_02_04...
2. KORDOBA historisch: alle relevanten Konten bis einschl. 01.02.2013
-> billpayC24_accepted_2013-02-04
3. billpayC24_accepted_2013-XX-XX

Report 2 revenue:
1.EVOLAN historisch: alle relevanten Transaktionen bis einschl. 29.01.2013
-> billpayEV_ges_revenue_2013-02-04
2. EVOLAN Report von gestern mit allen relevanten Konten vom 30.01. - 01.02.13
-> billpayEV_accepted_2013-02-04
3. ab heute wird jeweils Mo.-Fr. um 16.00 Uhr ein EVOLAN-Report mit den Daten
von jeweils gestern abgelegt
-> billpayEV_revenue_2013-XX-XX
4. KORDOBA historisch: alle bisherigen Buchungen bis einschl. 31.01.2013
-> billpayC2_revenue_2013-02-04
5. KORDOBA aktuell: Report von gestern mit Buchungen vom 01.02.2013
6. ab heute wird jeweils Mo.-Fr. um 16.00 Uhr ein KORDOBA-Report mit den Daten
von jeweils gestern abgelegt
-> billpayC24_revenue_2013-XX-XX

Report 3 canceled:
1. EVOLAN -> billpay_cancelled
2. KORDOBA -> billpayC24_cancelled

Report 4 update:verbleibt erstmal wie er ist aus EVOLAN, im Laufe des Monats wird hier ein Report aus KORDOBA zu generiert.

Report 5 declined: da die Daten grds. aus ORCA kommen, gibt es im Grunde keine Änderung. Report wird täglich automatisch auf dem Server bereitgestellt.

Report 6 pre-accepted:da die Daten grds. aus ORCA kommen, gibt es im Grunde keine Änderung. Report wird täglich automatisch auf dem Server bereitgestellt.
item.summary: shopping portal CSV Reports Anpassungen

comments.comment: @Sepi: the import seems to work technically. Can you please check with Jan if the imported data is correct.
Yes, I can do that. But therefor it needs to be live, isn't it? And this is actually not the case, right?
No, it's not live. The idea is to test it and if it works correctly to put it live then. You can test with Jan on his local machine.
There are still some missing date. I need to talk with hanseatic to find out what the problem is.
we tested it and it seems to work correctly now

item.title: [IPL-10080] DE - Create Integration Tests for preauthorize/capture request
item.description:
Introduction

We want to do regression / integration tests for our new decision engine. Note: This task will be specified during the 46. sprint. (so we know better what to test)

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Just integration tests for non-DE requests Integration tests for DE and non-DE requests

Create integration tests for Decision Engine:

  • Create preAuthorize tests for decision engine reusing already existing preAuthorize tests for non decision engine requests. Therefore create a new merchant (MID 500) with one or more portals that use the dummy workflow "dummy_it_test". Create the merchant via SQL insert file Don't duplicate all the test request files.
    If it is considered worth it and doable consider to make parametrize tests configuring them with (portal id, merchant id, merchant portal password) configurations.
  • Confirm that tests expected data is the same and can also be reused from existing tests.
  • Confirm that already existing tests for non-decision engine requests are still passing.

The following tests will be covered in the "Unit test" User Story (IPL-10079) and should be mocked for the created preAuthorize tests:

  • Workflow testing /Risk- Testing - requests Decision Engine/Non- Decision Engine;
  • Client/server interaction;
TODO
  • create SQL file for new merchant data that uses the dummy workflow ("dummy_it_test")
  • create 15 new tests for preauthorize request (test cases will be provided)

5 kind of test cases;

1
2 Customer with 3 open debts should be rejected
3 customer with high order amount, should be denied (limit reached)
4 customer which is whitelisted,(customer whitelisted)
5 Blaclkisted customer, should be denied blaclisted
item.summary: DE - Create Integration Tests for preauthorize/capture request

comments.comment:
main_workflow:
Hier werden keine Auskunfteien angefragt, Ergebnisse sind abhängig vom Nachnamen.
Herr oder Frau Darfnix bekommt bei der Schufa ein "P" und wird somit abgelehnt.
Herr oder Frau "Darfwas_A" (oder "DarfwasA") bekommt ein "A" und wird angenommen ("Darfwas_B" oder "DarfwasB" ein B, usw. ).
Ihr könnt also Nachnamen die auf A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H enden bis zum Umfallen testen.
Nachnamen die auf A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H enden bekommen den Score A

Hey Julia&Jan preAuth tests like they are now are running offline and invoking the mock (DecisionEngineOfflineServiceImpl)

[20:22:22] Ricardo Rodrigues: also bank account as to be valid you can use Billpay's bank account for Germany Invoice 10050000 / 190049464

item.title: [IPL-687] Zertifizierung des Oxid-Plugins
item.description:
Um die Zertifizierung durchführen zu können, muss eine virtuelle Testumgebung aufgesetzt werden. In dieser Testumgebung müssen dann mitgelieferte Testsequenzen gegen das zu zertifizierende Modul ausgeführt werden. Die Ergebnisse des Tests werden in den Zertifizierungsantrag eingetragen und an Oxid geschickt.

Muss aufgrund des doch recht großen Aufwands eingeplant werden.

http://www.oxid-esales.com/de/exchange
http://wiki.oxidforge.org/Certification/Modules
http://wiki.oxidforge.org/Downloads/VMware
item.summary: Zertifizierung des Oxid-Plugins

comments.comment: Dirk ist im Gespräch mikt Herr Steiner von Oxid, könnten auf den Marktplatz kommen, wennn wir zertifiziert sind, könnten damit Leads generieren.

Hallo Jan,


   Preparing the certification/developing environment:

    - install virtual machine (8h)
    - install oxid shop on the new virtual machine base on certification specification (2h + 1h specific version )
      ( Deepens also what version do we want to get certification. if we want certification for more versions then we need to install every specific version
        More versions means also that our plugin code need to meet specific versions characteristics )
    - Run Oxid shop tests (3h)
    - Install Test Module (6h)
    - Run Test Module (2h)
    - Install our module and run test (1h)
    - Interpret results for the fist time (2h)

   Billpay module code review

    - Split large functions (8h+)
      (also do test driven development spiting the functions and writing the tests)
    - Write getter and setter function for all global classes proprieties
    - Check and replace PHP super global usages (1h)
    - Remove logic from templates files (6h)
    - Check oxSuperCfg and oxExceptions (2h)
    - oxBlogs in templates (2h)
    - Databases access slave mater (2h)
    - Inter-modular compatibility (3h)
    - Documentation (6h)
 
    * Run Module tests and interpret results
    ( done after changes are done to the plugin )

    Write unit test

    - write unit test for all remaining functions
    - run interpret test

Thank you and if there are questions please let me know

All the best
Catalin
Sum = 57h

item.title: [IPL-10996] DriveNow Integration Changes in agreed <article_data> section
item.description:
Alexej Schwed to provide the german and english version for the articleName

Change the agreed <article_data> section as follows.

Old:
<article articleid="123456" articlequantity="1"
articlename="one drive" articledescription="DriveNow" ...

New:
German:
<article articleid="drivenow" articlequantity="1" articlename="Genehmigung Ihrer Fahrt mit DriveNow am DD.MM.YYYY" articledescription="DriveNow" articleprice="3000" articlepricegross="3000" />

English:
<article articleid="drivenow" articlequantity="1" articlename="Approval of your drive with DriveNow on DD.MM.YYYY" articledescription="DriveNow" articleprice="3000" articlepricegross="3000" />

The date DD.MM.YYYY is always our Capture date
item.summary: DriveNow Integration Changes in agreed <article_data> section

comments.comment: Waiting for feedback relative to if we can use Invoice date coming from UDK file or we have to retrieve captured date from db

We will skipp the date and only save the articleName in different languages.

For that, we need to fetch the locale from portal id and udk reference, which is something that we were already doing, so no significant overhead will be added, no extra db call will be needed.

The static article names will be added to language property files.
The limitation is if the customer drive now, adds new languages (locales) a corresponding static message in the respective property file has to be added, the code doesn't need to be changed.

If no message is found German is the default.

item.title: [IPL-10963] Creating MT104 files fails with NullPointerException
item.description:
EXCEPTION:

2013-05-04 05:00:10,090 [ERROR] net.ipaylater.backend.jobs.base.AbstractJob.executeInternal(AbstractJob.java:53) - Error running Processing mt104 files
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at net.ipaylater.backend.utils.Mt104Builder.<init>(Mt104Builder.java:94)
        at net.ipaylater.backend.service.transactions.processing.export.impl.Mt104CreateServiceImpl.createFiles(Mt104CreateServiceImpl.java:164)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:309)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:183)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:150)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:110)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:172)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:202)
        at $Proxy72.createFiles(Unknown Source)
        at net.ipaylater.backend.jobs.Mt104BatchJob.runJob(Mt104BatchJob.java:32)
        at net.ipaylater.backend.jobs.base.AbstractJob.executeInternal(AbstractJob.java:45)
        at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:216)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)

Please also improve logging: log all processed subdebt ids in the quartz.log.

Fix this also in branch for Sprint 48 -> requires a hotfix deploy
item.summary: Creating MT104 files fails with NullPointerException

item.description:
Secure the page with spring security.
In general the user has the right to view the pages.
Create new right for storing the new rate model.
Should be allowed,
for ADMINS
customer care,
Merchant,
item.summary: (IPL-10783) BO - Secure the pages with spring security tags

item.title: [IPL-10985] (IPL-10783) BO - Adjust View and display logic
item.description:
Create drop down and save button.

Invoke display logic from previous ticket

Load necessary data and change necessary classes for it. You might want to reuse method created in previous task to retrieve all options.
item.summary: (IPL-10783) BO - Adjust View and display logic

item.title: [IPL-10984] (IPL-10783) Create display check for conditions drop-down
item.description:
When rendering the BO GUI for the TC payment options for a certain portal, we do the following: If the table ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option contains entries -> display drop-down in the BO and a save button in order to let the merchant select a set of conditions.

For this task you should create the procedure that check if merchant_configuration_payment_option has entries and return true or false based on that
item.summary: (IPL-10783) Create display check for conditions drop-down

item.title: [IPL-10983] (IPL-10783) Create new table "ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option"
item.description:
We have to provide a new table: "ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option", where we save the conditions (values) for each portal TC/country/currency combination. This new table has the same structure as ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment. Primary Key has to be auto increment (Not portal ID)

Note: ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option table is maintained directly from IT in the DB. No UI in the BO for these TC-condition-models.

Add new column mrcp_transaction_credit_model_id to ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment
item.summary: (IPL-10783) Create new table "ipaylater_merchant.merchant_configuration_payment_option"

comments.comment: @Jan, please review it.
added foreign key to mrcp_transaction_credit_model_id

item.title: [IPL-10975] (IPL-10808) BO - Adjust ipaylater_customer.partial_cancel_order to Decline PC requests when "No cart"
item.description:
Decline PC requests when the "No cart" condition is true.

Adjust ipaylater_customer.partial_cancel_order and return new error code and error messages. That way the check will also be done from PCs initiated in the BO (although doing a PC via BO should not be possible anymore because their is no GUI for it anymore).

Create a helper function 'is_no_cart_order' (main order id)
item.summary: (IPL-10808) BO - Adjust ipaylater_customer.partial_cancel_order to Decline PC requests when "No cart"

comments.comment: Created the function ipaylater_customer.is_no_cart_order(bigint)

Creation of new error message is not necessary here.
It will be used the error_id = 307 -- PARTIAL_CANCEL_NOT_ALLOWED
Developer tests were done with existing partial cancellation tests.
Please review it, Wieslaw

item.title: [IPL-10973] (IPL-10807) BO - Fix display logic for activation
item.description:
The activation button should show up by the condition described in main ticket.
Please remember that this task considers, the grid view in the request\orders overview.
Be sure that the logic should be combined with the current logic. For example when the order is canceled then the button should not show up.
Test, for

  • not partial activation portal,
  • with partial activation, and proces by ammount condition is fullfiled
  • with PA and process by amount condition is not fullfiled (flag is false, and in the cart there are no special item)
item.summary: (IPL-10807) BO - Fix display logic for activation

item.title: [IPL-10823] (IPL-10807) BO - Create view & adjust display logic for Activation Amount dialog

if partial activation is enabled and the main order is a "No cart" order, then display a dialog view where the user can insert the desired amount for activation.

The maximum amount should be validated, it should be the rest amount for doing full activation.
Validation server side and client side.

There are two views.
One in order details view
order_detail.jsp
directInvoiceGrid.tag
Please be sure that those will have the same or close to same logic.
item.summary: (IPL-10807) BO - Create view & adjust display logic for Activation Amount dialog

item.title: [IPL-10956] [Follow-Up Ticket] General Bugs on Lettershop
item.description:
1. There is a bug with our Lettershop, if the customer is a B2B ... customer.

The first and last name isnt fetched properly (see attachment)

This example is for Invoice DEU dunning 2 letter.

TODO

  • check, why it happens and fix it
  • provide corner test cases, with only the company name and see what happens (check back with Duc)

2. some more bugs

TODO
A. check why "Emp?nger" is occuring (it should be Empfänger)
B. Can we display either Kontonummer/BLZ or IBAN/BIC depending on what we are actually sending?

to B. The following data are examples, don't use them!

Empfänger: Billpay GmbH
Kontonummer: 3455106849
Bankleitzahl: 10050000
Bank: Berliner Sparkasse
Verwendungszweck: BP49135/3058

OR

Empfänger: Billpay GmbH
IBAN: DE89370400440532013000
BIC: DEUTDEFF500
Bank: Berliner Sparkasse
Verwendungszweck: BP49135/3058
item.summary: [Follow-Up Ticket] General Bugs on Lettershop

comments.comment:
We always have first name and last name, also for B2B requests. But in case of B2B the data is stored in a different place:

  cc_contact_person_firstname
  cc_contact_person_lastname
  cc_contact_person_gender

In order to determine whether it is a B2B or a B2C request, use cdr_request_customer_group and NOT c_customer_group!
This bug should have been fixed a long time ago. Needs to be checked again.

item.title: [IPL-10933] Refactor BillpayOrderState enum
item.description:
IS:
The enum is a combination of values from tables rating_validation_state and pre_validation_states. Right now we are using this enum for translation purpose in the backoffice.

SHOULD BE:
Remove this enum and replace it with a generic mechanism that loads the values from the tables. prevalidation states are already in the cache and ready to use, rating validation states not yet. Adjust translation files to use the names from pvs_detail and rvs_info.
item.summary: Refactor BillpayOrderState enum

item.title: [IPL-10932] Refactor prestate/mainstate/poststate mapping
item.description:
remove PreStateType/StateType/PostStateType enums and all related mapping code.

These static mappings are not necessary and they make adding new states (which is a common thing we do) unflexible.
item.summary: Refactor prestate/mainstate/poststate mapping

item.title: [IPL-10927] Sequence of partial cancel and EditCart content does not work
item.description:
For order /OrderDetail.action?orderId=5888287,
again there was a broken order.
Sequence of request for Edit Cart Content and Partial Cancel.
Made the cart broken.
Create a test case for this issue.
There is one already existing.

Important: The order was manualy fixed on live.
To reproduce we need to find the requests from the logs.

In the customer order items.
After Partial cancel of one item, on the main order the partial canceled item was redurced by -1 and on the suborder the item was reduced by -2. items.
item.summary: Sequence of partial cancel and EditCart content does not work

item.title: [IPL-9821] Adjustments for merchant invoice CSV
item.description:
1) Sometimes dates and the country is missing (e.g. for full cancel rows and payments on the main order)
2) "Bestelldatum" and "Aktivierungsdatum" are always set to the same day.
3) Don't show rows for prescore fees

1) and 2) exist since the introduction of Partial Activation. The generation of the CSV file still relies on the debt object only and doesn't take into account that when dealing with the main order there is no debt object.

An Example for 1) and 2) is attached.

TODO:

  • rewrite queries in ipaylater_merchant.get_merchant_invoice_as_csv
item.summary: Adjustments for merchant invoice CSV

comments.comment: example missing :(
Attached it now

is a relict from partial activation.

ipaylater_merchant.get_merchant_invoice_as_csv needs to be fixed. It's still relying on the debt object.

item.title: [IPL-10784] Update Dunning 2 Fee for Invoice- for EUR-DEU/EUR-AT
item.description:
Update all dunning fee 2 for Invoice DEU/AUT (EUR) from 5 Euro to 6 Euro, where dunning fee 2 is 5 Euro.
Note: All other values than 5 Euro, the dunning fee 2 stay as they are -> no update. (Because they have special agreements with us)
Note: Apply for factoring and non-factoring -> 6 Euro!

Set default value also to 6 Euro for dunning 2 - INV DEU/AUT (EUR)
item.summary: Update Dunning 2 Fee for Invoice- for EUR-DEU/EUR-AT
